articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday named co-campaign chair Susie Wiles as his White House chief of staff, one of the most important nonelected posts in Washington.
articles.content:
President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday named co-campaign chair Susie Wiles as his White House chief of staff, one of the most important nonelected posts in Washington.
She will be the first woman in that role.

articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump has named Susie Wiles, the defacto manager of his victorious campaign, as his White House chief of staff, the first woman to hold the influential role.
articles.content:

articles.title: Trump won as voters declared independence from the elites
articles.description: This extraordinary election wasn't about Donald Trump or Kamala Harris, but something much more fundamental: Americans rising up and declaring independence from the centralized power of Washington, DC.
articles.content:
“You are not ordinary!”
That’s what Donald Trump told a voter who described himself as an “ordinary American” while the former president served fries at a McDonald’s in Bucks County, Pa.

articles.title: These Latino and Black voters were once Democrats, but Donald Trump changed everything
articles.description: Democrats were once able to count on their popularity among multiple racial demographics in the US, but some in these groups — including Latinos and Black men — are turning their backs on the party. This is why.
